resources.string:
Encryption Methods: 


Binary: This converts all of your letters into binary numbers (simply 1's and 0's). 


Base-64: This converts your text into a more concise readable format for computers more efficient to transport large sums of data.

Hexadecimal: This converts your text into numbers of base 16 (ranging from 0 to f). 


MD5: This takes your text and converts it into a more secure format that cannot be decrypted back, it is used to store passwords in some places. 


Octal: This converts your text into numbers of base 8 (ranging from 0 to 7). 


ROT13: This converts your text by transforming each letter 13 characters forward/backward in the alphabet, although it seems simple, it is great for simple encryption needs. 


Unicode: This converts your text into their Unicode values (an agreed upon number format of the alphabet and other symbols and characters as well).
